reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The previous review is perfect. Aleli by the Sea is a great guest house for those looking for the perfect Condado location on a budget. We stayed in room #7 and were very satisfied. There is a view of the beach and you can open your window and listen to the surf all night long. It is not fancy and is a bit rough around the edges, but its perfectly adequate for those looking for a base from which to explore San Juan. (The hotel is in the best part of Condado - is 10 min. from Isla Verde and 5-10 minute from Old San Juan).
reviews.title: Great Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach in front of the Aleli is nice. It is not as wide and flat as the beaches in Isla Verde. It was, however, nicer than I expected and would be great for laying out and relaxing. (Of course the deck at the Aleli is perfect for that too!) Also, it was just a short walk down the sand to some beaches that would be great for playing in the surf and letting children wade in the shallow waves.

reviews.text: When we’re on the Internet searching for a low budget hotel what do we expect? Well, if you’re like me you want a clean room with a comfortable bed, an air-conditioner that works well, and a color TV with a remote. We cannot realistically expect to pay $69 - $109 a day and get accommodation equivalent to The Intercontinental or The El San Juan Hotel and Casino! My husband and I just got back from staying 9 days at the Aleli By the Sea Guesthouse. We got everything that we expected and more! This small guesthouse is the most affordable place on the beach. They have a few rooms that are oceanfront but even if you have one towards the back, the Aleli has a lovely deck facing the ocean, which is just a few feet away. It has a lovely sit-in kitchen, which is delightful if you want to stick to a tighter budget and cook a meal instead. The housekeeper will clean your room every day and your sheets and towels will be changed as well.

Perfect for the Price
reviews.text: Aleli By the Sea has the best of both worlds. It is situated right on the beach but

Keep in mind that this is a guest house, not a hotel. There are no frills. The rooms, while clean, are very, very small. We stayed in room 4 which costs a bit more, but has its own bathroom (a major plus) and is just off the deck. It offers a little more privacy than the other rooms since it's entrance is outside on the deck and not part of the main house. Worth the extra cost!
reviews.title: oceanfront location without the high price
definitly no frills, but great oceanfront location
reviews.text: The location of this hotel just can't be beat. It is one of several guest houses situated right on the beach between the Marriot and new construction. It is centrally located in Condado and within easy walking distance to restaurants, stores and the bus line. There are alot of gay travelers staying in these guest houses so if that would bother you, I wouldn't recommend staying here.

Our only complaint was that the steps leading from the deck to the beach were broken and not expected to be fixed soon. Therefore, we could not access the beach from the deck. We had to walk around several guest houses to get down to the beach. Not a huge inconvienence as it wasn't that far, but would have been great to leave our deck (which has an incredible view) and be on the beach.
reviews.title: Muy Bien
Great Value in Condado Beach
reviews.text: Puerto Rico's beaches are quite dirty, so don't expect a resort type appearance. There is grafitti on the walls and garbage in the sand. However, the water is warm, clean and sandy (no seaweed or rocks to wade through). Waves a bit high for little kids to swim in though. Be prepared to pay $3 for a chair and $10 for an umbrella.

reviews.title: Lowest Priced on the Beach Hotel on the Island!
reviews.text: If you are looking to spend alot of time in your room, don't stay here. Go to the Marriot about 200 yds down and pay double the price. If you just need a place to sleep where you can hear the surf in your room at night, then this is the place for you.

My buddy and I decided to sneak away for a few days of sun in the Carribean. I had stayed in Condado 4 years ago, but not right on the ocean, and I always wanted to go back. We stumbled upon Aleli-By-The-Sea using TripAdvisor and this is THE most affordable place on the beach, if you don't need traditional "white-glove service." The staff was laid-back + friendly and Aleli is in the perfect location in town. If booking, I highly recommend room no 8; on the 2nd floor: overlooks the ocean, windows let in the cool ocean breeze, ceiling fan, AC, small cable tv, desk, bathroom in room. Other residents said their windows did not open, so def. get Room 8.
